summary.p: The Vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam is a narrative telling the legend of Vaḷḷi, the consort of Murukaṉ. It appears to be an epitome of the Kantapurāṇam (Taylor 1845, p. 61).
The manuscript gives the text (mūlam) interspersed with a commentary/summary, thus the title given as Vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇacāram.
The text is incomplete. See description of U2 and mention of missing folios.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (February 2020).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

support.p: The edges of U2, f108‒f113 and f202‒f213 are rounded.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇacāram: Title Page (additional). No foliation. Single folio. Verso blank. Hand #1.

248 folios = Vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇacāram: Text. Tamil foliation 1‒30, 32-62, 64, 66, 68-69, 69-209, 247-288. f31, f63, f65, f67, f210‒f246 missing. f68‒f69 refoliated 67‒68. 2 folios foliated 69. 5 to 6 lines per page, by several hands (see fr288, rm).

supportDesc.condition: Fairly good state of preservation, considering the age of the manuscript and in spite of bore holes caused by insects. Some folios are truncated.

additions.desc:
Title written (incised) in two parts on the front and back wood covers:
vaḷḷiyāmma
ṉ pūpurāṇam
Thus: Vaḷḷiyāmmaṉ Purāṇam. The front woodcover is further inscribed pu ta (in smaller letters, below the letter ḷi), that is, puttakam (?).

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year naḷa of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1856-1857, 1796-1797, 1736-1737, etc. See colophon (U2, f288v3). Dated to circa December 7th, 1736 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1736 by Cabaton (1912).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
